references.paper_title: Coolmoves: User motion accentuation in virtual reality
references.reason: This paper is cited as a method for full body pose estimation from sparse inputs, and is important for comparison.

references.paper_title: Bodiffusion: Diffusing sparse observations for full-body human motion synthesis
references.reason: This is a key comparison paper using diffusion models, demonstrating the state of the art before this work.

references.paper_title: Hmd-poser: On-device real-time human motion tracking from scalable sparse observations
references.reason: This is a concurrent work, proposing a similar approach for solving the problem, showing the significance of the paper.

references.paper_title: Avatarposer: Articulated full-body pose tracking from sparse motion sensing
references.reason: This paper is referenced for its use of transformer encoders and inverse kinematics to solve the problem of ego-body pose estimation, providing a baseline for comparison.

references.paper_title: Masked autoencoders are scalable vision learners
references.reason: This paper is the foundation for the temporal completion module, which imputes missing hand poses through spatiotemporal correlations.
